title: How to Freeze Garlic
description:
Did you know that when frozen, garlic can keep for up to SIX MONTHS!? This quick video will show you #howto properly freeze garlic!

Read more: https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Garlic

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: two fries garlic after it has been chopped or split into cloves peel each piece of garlic that you plan on freezing then wrap all of the garlic in a single piece of aluminum foil or plastic wrap place the wrapped garlic in a resealable freezer bag press out any excess air in the bag before sealing it tightly label the bag with the date place the bag in the freezer to keep the garlic for up to 6 monthstwo fries garlic after it has been chopped or split into cloves peel each piece of garlic that you plan on freezing then wrap all of the garlic in a single piece of aluminum foil or plastic wrap place the wrapped garlic in a resealable freezer bag press out any excess air in the bag before sealing it tightly label the bag with the date place the bag in the freezer to keep the garlic for up to 6 months

title: How to Freeze Zucchini
description:
Learn how to freeze zucchini with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Freeze-Zucchini

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to freeze zucchini rinse it off and cut into half inch slices or cubes bring a pot of water to a boil add the zucchini pieces and boil them for three to four minutes next plunge the zucchini into an ice bath for three to four minutes drain the zucchini and pat it dry then arrange the pieces in a single layer on a baking sheet and freeze them for one to two hours before transferring the pieces to freezer-safe bags or containers store your zucchini in the freezer for up to 14 months for tips on preparing shredded zucchini for freezing read onto freeze zucchini rinse it off and cut into half inch slices or cubes bring a pot of water to a boil add the zucchini pieces and boil them for three to four minutes next plunge the zucchini into an ice bath for three to four minutes drain the zucchini and pat it dry then arrange the pieces in a single layer on a baking sheet and freeze them for one to two hours before transferring the pieces to freezer-safe bags or containers store your zucchini in the freezer for up to 14 months for tips on preparing shredded zucchini for freezing read on

title: How to Fry Fish
description:
Learn how to fry fish with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Fry-Fish

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/wikihow/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@wikihow
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
subtitles: to fry fish on the stovetop first fill a skillet with about two inches five centimeters of vegetable oil heat the oil on high until it starts to smoke while the oil heats fill a small bowl with all-purpose flour and a second bowl with bread crumbs and a third bowl with a few whisked eggs dip each fish fillet in the bowl of flour so both sides are coated then dip the fillet in the egg mixture followed by the bread crumbs so the filet is fully coated once all your fillets are battered carefully place them in the skillet and fry them for two minutes flip the fish with a pair of tongs and cook them for two more minutes or until they're golden brown transfer the filets to a paper towel and let the excess oil drain before servingto fry fish on the stovetop first fill a skillet with about two inches five centimeters of vegetable oil heat the oil on high until it starts to smoke while the oil heats fill a small bowl with all-purpose flour and a second bowl with bread crumbs and a third bowl with a few whisked eggs dip each fish fillet in the bowl of flour so both sides are coated then dip the fillet in the egg mixture followed by the bread crumbs so the filet is fully coated once all your fillets are battered carefully place them in the skillet and fry them for two minutes flip the fish with a pair of tongs and cook them for two more minutes or until they're golden brown transfer the filets to a paper towel and let the excess oil drain before serving

title: How to Chop Broccoli
description:
Learn How to Chop Broccoli with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Chop-Broccoli

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: two chopped broccoli firstly the broccoli on its side on a cutting board then use a sharp chef's knife to cut the florets away from the stock chop the florets into smaller pieces by cutting them in half lengthwise don't throw away the stock from the broccoli the stock is sweet and crunchy and you can cut it up and add it to your recipe along with the florets to cut the stock first remove the tough outer layer using a vegetable peeler or paring knife then cut the stalk lengthwise into thin slices finally make evenly spaced cuts across the slices to chop the stalk into smaller pieces be sure to practice knife safetytwo chopped broccoli firstly the broccoli on its side on a cutting board then use a sharp chef's knife to cut the florets away from the stock chop the florets into smaller pieces by cutting them in half lengthwise don't throw away the stock from the broccoli the stock is sweet and crunchy and you can cut it up and add it to your recipe along with the florets to cut the stock first remove the tough outer layer using a vegetable peeler or paring knife then cut the stalk lengthwise into thin slices finally make evenly spaced cuts across the slices to chop the stalk into smaller pieces be sure to practice knife safety

title: How to Chop Cilantro
description:
Learn How to Remove Hair Dye from Skin with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Remove-Hair-Dye-from-Skin

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: two chopped cilantro start by cutting off the stems with a sharp knife then use the knife that chop the bundle of cilantro in half now take one of the piles and fold it in half holding it with your fingers next place the knife at one end of the folded pile and quickly rock it back and forth as you work your way across the cilantro once the first pile is chopped repeat with the second pile of cilantro and then you're finishedtwo chopped cilantro start by cutting off the stems with a sharp knife then use the knife that chop the bundle of cilantro in half now take one of the piles and fold it in half holding it with your fingers next place the knife at one end of the folded pile and quickly rock it back and forth as you work your way across the cilantro once the first pile is chopped repeat with the second pile of cilantro and then you're finished

title: How to Chop Garlic
description:
Learn How to Chop Garlic with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Chop-Garlic

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to chop garlic select a bulb of garlic and use your fingers to pull a single clove away from the bulb place the clove on a cutting board or other flat surface and lay the blade of the knife flat against the clove then carefully press the palm of your hand firmly against the knife to crack the skin and peel the skin off of the clove once the skin is removed place the clove flat on the cutting board cut it once horizontally and then shift to cut the clove vertically you can repeat to make the pieces of garlic smaller depending on the recipeto chop garlic select a bulb of garlic and use your fingers to pull a single clove away from the bulb place the clove on a cutting board or other flat surface and lay the blade of the knife flat against the clove then carefully press the palm of your hand firmly against the knife to crack the skin and peel the skin off of the clove once the skin is removed place the clove flat on the cutting board cut it once horizontally and then shift to cut the clove vertically you can repeat to make the pieces of garlic smaller depending on the recipe

title: How to Clean a Coffee Maker with Vinegar
description:
Learn How to Clean a Coffee Maker with Vinegar with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Clean-a-Coffee-Maker-with-Vinegar

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to clean a coffee maker with vinegar first empty the carafe in any coffee grounds in the filter then fill the water chamber with equal parts white vinegar and water and run a brew cycle halfway through the cycle turn your coffee maker off let it sit for one hour so the vinegar has time to clean it then turn your coffee maker back on and let it finish the rest of the brew cycle dump out the vinegar and water solution and refill the water chamber with fresh water finally run another brew cycle then repeat two more times to ensure all of the vinegar is goneto clean a coffee maker with vinegar first empty the carafe in any coffee grounds in the filter then fill the water chamber with equal parts white vinegar and water and run a brew cycle halfway through the cycle turn your coffee maker off let it sit for one hour so the vinegar has time to clean it then turn your coffee maker back on and let it finish the rest of the brew cycle dump out the vinegar and water solution and refill the water chamber with fresh water finally run another brew cycle then repeat two more times to ensure all of the vinegar is gone

title: How to Clean a Scorched Pan
description:
Learn How to Clean a Scorched Pan with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Clean-a-Scorched-Pan

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: if you've scorched a pan while cooking start cleaning it by filling it with enough warm water to cover the scorched areas then squeeze three to four drops of dish detergent into the water place the pan on the stove and bring the water to a boil after you've let the pan boil for 10 minutes let it cool before scrubbing it clean alternatively try adding 1 cup 240 milliliters of vinegar to the water instead of the detergent bring the pan to a boil remove the pan from the heat and add 2 tablespoons of baking soda which will help remove the scorch debrisif you've scorched a pan while cooking start cleaning it by filling it with enough warm water to cover the scorched areas then squeeze three to four drops of dish detergent into the water place the pan on the stove and bring the water to a boil after you've let the pan boil for 10 minutes let it cool before scrubbing it clean alternatively try adding 1 cup 240 milliliters of vinegar to the water instead of the detergent bring the pan to a boil remove the pan from the heat and add 2 tablespoons of baking soda which will help remove the scorch debris

title: How to Clean a Toaster
description:
Learn How to Clean a Toaster with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Clean-a-Toaster

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/wikiHow
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
subtitles: to clean a toaster first unplug the toaster remove the crumb tray if there is one the crumb tray should easily slide out of the front of your toaster dump out any crumbs wash the tray with soap and water while it's drying tip your toaster upside down into the garbage to remove any other crumbs then dip an old toothbrush or cleaning brush in some vinegar brush the heating coils inside the toaster use a cloth dipped in vinegar to scrub and polish the outside of the toasterto clean a toaster first unplug the toaster remove the crumb tray if there is one the crumb tray should easily slide out of the front of your toaster dump out any crumbs wash the tray with soap and water while it's drying tip your toaster upside down into the garbage to remove any other crumbs then dip an old toothbrush or cleaning brush in some vinegar brush the heating coils inside the toaster use a cloth dipped in vinegar to scrub and polish the outside of the toaster

title: How to Clean Broccoli
description:
Learn how to clean broccoli with this guide from wikiHow: https://www.wikihow.com/Clean-Broccoli

Follow our social media channels to find more interesting, easy, and helpful guides!

Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/wikihow/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/wikihow/
TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@wikihow
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/wikiHow/
subtitles: to clean broccoli first fill a sink with cold water and submerge the broccoli in it let the broccoli soak for five minutes then drain the sink and place the broccoli in a colander run it under cold water for two to three minutes to rinse off any remaining dirt shake the broccoli to knock the excess water off then pat it dry with a paper towel for extra dirty broccoli fill a bowl with three parts water and one part white vinegar submerge the broccoli in the vinegar solution for 15 minutes finally rinse the broccoli under cool water to remove any residue from the vinegarto clean broccoli first fill a sink with cold water and submerge the broccoli in it let the broccoli soak for five minutes then drain the sink and place the broccoli in a colander run it under cold water for two to three minutes to rinse off any remaining dirt shake the broccoli to knock the excess water off then pat it dry with a paper towel for extra dirty broccoli fill a bowl with three parts water and one part white vinegar submerge the broccoli in the vinegar solution for 15 minutes finally rinse the broccoli under cool water to remove any residue from the vinegar
